properties.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 29 at 4:27AM AKST until January 29 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage, AK
properties.description:
* WHAT...Blizzard conditions. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph.
Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches.

* WHERE...Thompson Pass.

* WHEN...Until noon AKST today.

* IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult. Blowing snow will
reduce visibilities to one quarter mile or less at times. The
cold wind chills as low as 30 below zero could cause frostbite
on exposed skin in as little as 20 minutes.
properties.instruction:
A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are
expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds
and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout
conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel,
have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay
with your vehicle.

For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.

NWSheadline: BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST TODAY THROUGH THOMPSON PASS
